caption:
This photograph offers an aerial view of a large industrial area, showcasing an expansive complex of facilities associated with heavy industry and manufacturing. The landscape is densely packed with a variety of industrial buildings, large cylindrical storage tanks, and complex infrastructures like pipelines and railways.

The dominant features are the numerous large storage tanks of different sizes, predominantly concentrated on the right half of the image. These tanks appear to store liquids, possibly oil, chemicals, or other industrial fluids. There are also several large buildings with flat and sloped roofs, which may serve as factories, warehouses, or processing plants.

Toward the center and left side, the photograph shows tall smokestacks, some emitting thick smoke, which indicates active industrial processes. The presence of these smokestacks suggests heavy industrial activities, possibly involving steel production or chemical processing.

The layout includes a network of roads and railroad tracks that interconnect the various facilities, essential for the movement of goods and raw materials. In the background, beyond the industrial area, a river meanders through the scene, possibly used as a water source for the industrial processes or for transporting goods.

Overall, the area is dominated by man-made structures with minimal vegetation visible, highlighting the industrial focus of the region. The photograph captures a powerful scene of industrial might, but also raises considerations about environmental impacts and industrial sustainability.
title: Industrial complex along the Arthur Kill river in New Jersey in the New York metropolitan area.  Rivers which flow through this region carry raw and partially digested sewage, and chemical and industrial wastes into the waters of the bight.  Accumulation of these wastes in waters bordering the bight present one of the most critical stresses to its environment
